name: Stone Hill Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the 2nd time during Christmas weekend for a few days. Our room (the one at the end of the hall) was nice. Usual fireplace, bed, etc, but quieter than the last room we had as it is the last one down the hall.
reviews.title: Good again, 2nd time around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inn itself looks from the outside like a small hotel - it is not a refurbished house, which we like as we are usually the hotel bound people, not the old house B&B guests. The current inkeepers were pleasant and kind. The breakfasts were wonderful. Actually fantastic - I have an allergy and they specifically tailored some of the breakfast suggestions so I could enjoy them. Huge kudos to them for that.
reviews.title: It was beyond expectation!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the evening they would put out one dish that you could snack on, also nice if you were sitting in the living room or playing pool.
reviews.title: A luxury Inn with warm, personal hospitality! A must stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I think the price is a little steep, but it is actually comparable to everything else around, so no biggie. I would have preferred that the fireplaces were the real kind (vs electric), somewhat takes away from the feel of warming by the fire, especially in the main living room of the inn. Also the showers are the standard plastic mold type, again would have expected real stone for the price of the rooms.
reviews.title: Stone Hill Inn offers the type of getaway you think only exists in the movies.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, both of our experiences here have been very pleasant. We enjoy playing pool in the living room after a day on the slopes. Last year when we were here and I was pregnant, they gave us snowshoes to walk the trails which was great as well. Definitely a place we will return when we are in Stowe next year.
reviews.title: You will feel calm and relaxed as soon as you arrive at Stone Hill Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I arrived in the early afternoon of May 18 after a pleasant 5-hour drive to Stowe. At check-in, we met innkeepers Sue and Steve, who were very pleasant and helpful, and remained so throughout our 3-night stay. Sure, it is their job as hosts to be pleasant and helpful, but you are left with the impression that this is the type of people they are even when they are not working - the real deal.
reviews.title: For peace & quiet and R&R, this is the place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sue gave us a detailed tour of the building and grounds, explaining to us all the inn has to offer (which is quite a lot!) From a nice billiard table in the lobby, to the guest pantry stocked with complimentary soft drinks and snacks, and a microwave, refrigerator, and (I think) espresso/coffee machine. They have board games and a good selection of videos and DVDs available, a nice touch in the case of inclement weather or if you just want to stay in for the day. There is wireless Internet on the premises, which I did not try, so I cannot comment on its function. A desktop computer is available for guest use in the "solarium" a very large parlor with comfortable chairs, a fireplace, a table full of brochures for local attractions, and a stash of books. Outside the solarium is an outdoor hot tub, which we did not use. There is a complimentary laundry room (do-it-yourself), and a room with extra pillows and blankets!
reviews.title: A romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On to our room. We stayed in the room called "Moss Glen." All rooms are the same size and vary only in decor, bed style, etc. There is a gas-log fireplace, which we tried briefly on our first night. It worked well, and could probably heat the room by itself! Aside from its impeccable decor, and being a bit larger than most hotel rooms, the room is pretty standard, with a table, 2 chairs, and a very nice TV with excellent reception! There is also a DVD/VCR, ceiling fan, and heat & AC. There is an ample-sized closet with a safe.
reviews.title: Amazing, outragious, wonderful, warm, friendly B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom is HUGE. The jacuzzi worked great - I spent several hours in it! There is a double-sink vanity and large shower.
reviews.title: A perfect honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping is immaculate. There was not a thing wrong with cleanliness. My wife, as a housekeeper in a nursing home, has a critical eye for these things!
reviews.title: An idyllic luxury retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Inn is beautiful, modern, and spacious. The immaculately landscaped grounds and small waterfall enhance the quiet woodland setting. The staff were accessbile and helpful, and the breakfasts were delicious. The no childen policy ensured a restful atmosphere.
reviews.title: tranquil, lovely, comfortable with delicious breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited Stowe and stayed at Stone Hill two nights at the end of June. After researching places in this area the previous TripAdvisor reviews had clinched it for me.
reviews.title: Great inn experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is about 4 1/2 miles outside of Stowe Village on the road that leads to the ski resorts. I believe it was completed around 2000 and is a member of the Select Registry group of properties. There is a very nice bike/pedestrian path along the river nearby that connects to the village and continues beyond the inn. The Innkeepers, Sue, Nancy & Steve were extremely personable and called us by name from the start. The inn sets on a large private site that is beautifully landscaped. It is quite quiet, except for occasional light traffic on a nearby tertiary road. There are several lawn areas with a variety of benches, a great water feature and pond artfully integrated into the hillside, a massage pavilion and a hot tub, as well as paved parking and drop off. It is designated nonsmoking.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service, Best Breakfast, Romance all rolled in one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pubilic spaces are very nice for a facility of only nine rooms. There is a large living space with lounge furniture, a fireplace, billiard table, tables for playing games (with a game selection) or eating and cabinets with an assortment of movies for anyone's use. Adjacent is a guest pantry that is available 24/7 with free drinks, popcorn, coffee, etc. and a microwave and assortment of dishes and glassware. Appetizers are served for guests here each day from 5-7 pm. No alcohol is available on premises, but you can BYO. The dining room is good sized and surrounded by windows on three sides. There is also a reading room/study with a computer available for use and information on local attractions and restaurants.
reviews.title: Joe Average loved it and so did I

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The guest rooms (photos of each on their website) are all slightly different but to a consistent high level of quality with a good bed and linens, gas fireplace facing both the bedroom and bath, flat screen TV/DVD/VCR, and a huge bathroom with both whirlpool tub and shower. They are all on the ground level with sliding doors to the rear garden area. We had an end room (West Branch), which has the advantage of glass on two opposing sides of the room. Other amenities include an in-room safe (key type), iron & board, and a selection of pillows in an adjacent room on the hall.
reviews.title: Didn't Want to Leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really wanted to like this place because it seems to have all the right ingredients: beautiful location with well-manicured grounds for taking short walks, really nice, friendly and informative innkeepers, large rooms and a focus on creating an intimate, relaxed atmosphere. But, what distinguishes this from a truly special experience is the lack of attention to detail.
reviews.title: Heart's in the right place but attention to detail is lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the building and rooms are relatively new (built in the early 2000s) but the approach seems to have been more utilitarian than charming, creating a sense of perfunctory pseudo-luxury. The rooms are large, immaculately maintained and well-appointed with an LCD TV/DVR player, fireplace, etc. but the furnishings appear to have been selected more for functionality (and price?) than for form or esthetic. To wit, the large plastic, pre-fabricated shower in the bathroom, next to the jacuzzi. Other B&Bs we have liked in (Windham Hill Inn) and out (Washington School Inn, Park City, UT; Manka's, Inverness, CA, pre-fire) of Vermont have combined the bones of a beautifully restored building with thoughtful and thematically appropriate furniture, e.g. small antique armoires, poster beds, that feel genuine -- not generic and bland, as was the case here.
reviews.title: Fabulous once again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service-wise, there were small lapses. One night, we declined the turndown service and opened the door to find that the Lake Champlain chocolates destined for our pillows were left outside the door instead. While this was clearly thoughtful, there might have been a more appetizing place for them than on the floor. Perhaps in a little pouch hanging from the door handle?
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at breakfast and the little hors d'oeuvres in the evening were fine but, again, not as polished as other B&Bs we've been to and certainly not anything to rave about. The guest pantry with drinks and popcorn was a very sweet thought but, again, nicer beverages, e.g. brewed teas, local sodas, could have been offered in addition to the generic pop offerings. I'm not sure about the reason for not having one but an honor bar would have been nice as well.
reviews.title: A lovely Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, there were plenty of great things about Stone Hill Inn that other reviewers have extensively commented on. However, for the price point ($400+/night) and in view of what that buys from other B&Bs, the omissions and oddities above become increasingly glaring.
reviews.title: Gorgeous location-Impeccable Inn

description: This romantic and secluded Stowe Breakfast Inn was designed exclusively for couples: fireside Jacuzzis for two, king beds piled with pillows, spectacular gardens, haute breakfast cuisine at private tables, nightly turn down service, in-room massages for two, and a decor of hushed elegance throughout. Rooms begin at $245 per night.
